title: About Me
text:
My name is Harmony Nguyen, and I’m a project coordinator in the Cognition, Affect, and Temperament Lab at Penn State University. In my role, I lead a longitudinal study examining parent-child interactions and anxiety transmission over time.
After earning my BA in Psychology from Cal Poly Pomona, I moved to Pennsylvania to build on my research and data skills. Currently, I’m learning R for data manipulation, analysis, and visualization. In my future career, I plan to learn additional programming languages, so I can use my skills to leverage data and support non-profits that promote family and child well-being.
In my free time, I enjoy going to the gym, sightseeing, and going to Disneyland. I’m also love music and am an avid record collector! Below are some of my favorite songs of all time:

title: Harmony Nguyen
text:
Hello and welcome to my personal website! I created this to tell you more about myself, my interests, and my experiences. I’m a post-bacc researcher in the Cognition, Affect, and Temperament Lab and hope to pursue a career in child development and data management/science.


California Polytechnic State University, Pomona | Pomona, CA
Bachelor of Arts in Psychology | August 2018 - May 2022



Cognition, Affect, and Temperament Lab (PI: Koraly Pérez-Edgar, Ph.D.) | Project Coordinator | November 2022 - Present
College of Letters, Arts, and Social Science (PIs: Juliana Fuqua, Ph.D., Faye Wachs, Ph.D.) | Lead Undergraduate Research Assistant | October 2021 - May 2022
